column1: Narrator : Right next to the beach where the NOMBATEAU is, the crew steps in a wet and grassy field. A bit further away, they can see a farm.

column8: Narrator : It’s a small and charming farm, surrounded by fields. A young woman is around, apparently in the process of removing weeds. From here a path leads back to the beach and another goes further down the hills.

column1: Narrator : The smell of smoke gets stronger as CAPITAINE gets closer. The farm is burned to the ground, and not a single soul is here. Footsteps leading away from the farm are going to the beach.

column4: PlayerSpeak : Well well! Those papers mention NOMTRESOR! What luck!
column5: PlayerSpeak : Only some boring letters and recipes.

column4: PlayerSpeak : Some scribbles say to go DIRECTIONTOFORMULA...
column13: Narrator : A few chickens are roaming around a hen house, near the farm.

column14: Choice : (go and see the farmer girl)

column8: Narrator : CAPITAINE approaches the hen house.

column1: Narrator : The beach is empty, but the sails of a pirate ship can be seen in the distance.
Narrator : It looks like they are heading DIRECTIONTOFORMULA.
column8: Choice : Let’s return to the farmer girl. (leave)
column9: Choice : Let’s try and steal one! (dex)
column13: PlayerSpeak : The hens ran away to hide when I approached...

column5: PlayerSpeak : The beach is straight up empty
column11: PlayerSpeak : Oh no wait, it's just feathers.
column13: PlayerSpeak : Doesn’t matter, the farmer girl didn’t see me.

column4: PlayerSpeak : Just a cute little crab

column3: PlayerSpeak : The beach is straight up empty

column11: PlayerSpeak : Well, still better this than nothing I guess...

column9: PlayerSpeak : Looks like the farmer girl didn’t see us!

column1: Narrator : A group of pirates! They’re about to climb a rope ladder to their ship.
OtherSpeak : You’ll never get the treasure before us!
Choice : I’m not looking for trouble! (cha)
column3: Choice : You'll never see the treasure at all! (attack)
column4: Choice : You don't even know where the treasure is, do you? (cha)
column8: OtherSpeak : What do you think you're doing?
OtherSpeak : You’re gonna pay for this chicken right now!

column2: OtherSpeak : Well you found some anyway!
column4: OtherSpeak : Of course we do! It's DIRECTIONTOFORMULA...
column5: OtherSpeak : Do you really think we’re gonna tell you!

column4: OtherSpeak : ... Damn it, you got us! But we'll get it first anyway!

column8: Choice : That’s out of the question (attack)
column9: Choice : Oh sorry, I didn’t know it was yours... (cha)

column12: OtherSpeak : You can't even pay for my chicken?

column9: OtherSpeak : Well… You look hungry, you can keep it.
column10: OtherSpeak : How dumb do you think I am?
column12: OtherSpeak : I've had enough of you!

column1: Narrator : The corpses of the defeated pirates are scattered all around. Their boat is still on the beach.

column2: PlayerSpeak : What a well furnished pantry! Looks like these guys had just restocked!

column5: Choice : Do you like being alone here? (member)

column12: Choice : Do you know about NOMTRESOR?
column15: Choice : What’s up around the farm ? (quest)

column2: OtherSpeak : I only have enough to sustain my family. Good luck!
column4: OtherSpeak : Let me take a look at what we have!
column5: OtherSpeak : Not really alone, but I love the life I have here!
column8: OtherSpeak : Well since my grandpa died...

column5: OtherSpeak : My husband is just away fishing during the day as I tend to the farm.
column6: OtherSpeak : That's why I chose to be here on my own.
column8: OtherSpeak : I've been thinking of leaving.
column12: OtherSpeak : I see a lot of boats go in the same direction.
column13: OtherSpeak : Nope, never heard of it, sorry!

column12: OtherSpeak : I think they’re probably looking for that thing you talk about?
column15: OtherSpeak : It was my grandfathers farm.

column6: Choice : How about a job on our ship? (cha)
column15: OtherSpeak : It barely produces enough for me to eat.

column6: PlayerSpeak : Life on sea is calm and quiet too.
column8: PlayerSpeak : How about joining our crew?
PlayerSpeak : You grandad would be proud!

column1: Narrator : With the farm girl gone, the door of the house is wide open. A path leads further into the hills, another back to the boat.

column6: OtherSpeak : Oh why the hell not?
OtherSpeak : If you’ve got the room on board!
column7: OtherSpeak : The pirate life isn’t for me.

column1: Narrator : The house is completly empty.
Narrator : A windmill surrounded by fields can be seen between the hills.

column2: PlayerSpeak : We can’t see much from here.
column5: Narrator : A few crates of food are stacked in the corner.

column1: PlayerSpeak : What a view! It's breathtaking...

column4: PlayerSpeak : I wish I had an eyeglass...

column3: PlayerSpeak : Ah, we can see much further!
